alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Boyle; Bullitt; Casey; Franklin; Garrard; Green; Hardin; Jessamine; Larue; Lincoln; Madison; Marion; Meade; Mercer; Nelson; Shelby; Spencer; Taylor; Washington; Woodford (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 9:36AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Shelby, Nelson, southeastern Meade, Garrard, Anderson, southwestern Clark, Larue, Marion, northern Taylor, Jessamine, northeastern Hardin, southern Bullitt, northwestern Casey, Franklin, Spencer, northwestern Lincoln, Mercer, Woodford, southwestern Scott, northwestern Green, Washington, Boyle, northwestern Madison and Fayette Counties through 1030 AM EDT/930 AM CDT/... At 936 AM EDT/836 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles north of Frankfort to 7 miles southwest of Taylorsville to near Brandenburg. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Bardstown around 940 AM EDT. Frankfort around 945 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Elizabethtown, Versailles, Springfield, Lexington, Cardinal Hill, Meadowthorpe, Dunbar High School, Highlands, Northland, Thoroughbred Acres, Hodgenville, Chevy Chase, U K Arboretum, Fayette Mall, Bryan Station, Veterans Park and Cadentown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
